Annuals, biennials, or perennials (taprooted or roots fibrous); pappi 0 or coroniform (to 0.1 mm).

Stems and leaves softly pilose to woolly; style branch apices acute to obtuse; Alabama, Florida, Georgia, South Carolina

Proximal cauline leaves elliptic or ovate, usually 3(–5)-lobed; paleae cuspidate (tips awnlike, 1.5+ mm)

Stems and leaves glabrous or sparsely to moderately hairy; proximal cauline leaves not lobed; heads borne singly or (2–12) in corymbiform arrays.

Leaves: abaxial faces glabrous or strigose and gland-dotted; paleae: abaxial tips canescent or strigose, sometimes gland-dotted as well.
